author: craigmcc
msg: Initial checkin of a JavaSE 5 based layer on top of standard Shale functionality.
If you are running on such a JVM, you will be able to use this layer to utilize
the following annotation-based ease of use features:
- Declare managed beans with annotations instead of
configuration file entries (partially implemented).
- Declare POJOs that receive ViewController like
application callback events, to methods of any
name, without implementing the ViewController
interface (not yet implemented).
NOTE:  Although use of this library requires JavaSE 5, it does *not* require
JSF 1.2.  It will run against a JSF 1.1 implementation as well.
NOTE:  This module is not yet integrated into the Ant or Maven overall build
scripts.  You will need to check out the source and build it yourself.
NOTE:  The managed beans annotation processing is implemented in a custom
variable resolver, but this instance is *not* yet integrated into the JSF
runtime configuration.  That will be performed by an optional delegation
from the variable resolver in Shale's core library.
NOTE:  The managed beans implementation does not currently support the standard
<list-entries> or <map-entries> elements.  This will be implemented later.

author: ekoneil
msg: Incremental binding / type work.
- add a SchemaTypesLookupService that implements Class <> QName support for the core XSD / SOAP types
- add a BindingLookupServiceFactory.  This isn't used yet, but it's the kind of thing that will support getting different singletons / chains of type providers
- remove the isBuiltInType methods from the TypeRegistrar and AxisTypeMappingMetaData classes.  Makes things simpler...
BB: self
Test: WSM and web service control pass
